newsitem.title: USA: FIA urges reforms at LME after UK metals review.
newsitem.headline: FIA urges reforms at LME after UK metals review.

text.p: The U.S. Futures Industry Association (FIA) said it has called for changes at the London Metal Exchange (LME) after a recent review of the metals market following the Sumitomo Corp copper scandal.

The FIA said in a statement that its suggestions, responding to a market review by Britain's Securities Investment Board (SIB), addressed segregation of client assets, margin financing and non-cash clearing.
It added that those issues were also an important part of a report by the FIA Global Task Force on Financial Integrity following the Barings Bank scandal of 1995.

"The board of FIA continues to put a high priority on the recommendations issued in the Task Force report to promote financial integrity worldwide," FIA president Johm Damgard said in the statement. "We were pleased to be asked to share our views with the SIB and LME."

Sumitomo was said to have lost some $2.6 billion yen from illicit copper trades by former star trader Yasuo Hamanaka and Barings was seen to have racked up some $1.4 billion in unauthorized trades by Nick Leeson.
FIA said segregation of funds was vital in facilitating prompt transfer of client accounts in the event of a default.
It added that if customers are allowed to "opt out" of segregation, appropriate disclosure should be given to allow them to make an informed decision.

FIA said it recommended that the extension of margin financing to clients be restricted to transactions where the financing is recognized as an independent loan, accompanied by formal credit approvals.
The association said it also recommended "Historic Price Carries", which have been used to roll over losing positions, be eliminated.

FIA said non-cash clearing should be eliminated because it would increase the possibility of "pyramiding" trades by clients, allowing positive variation margin (cash flow in margin account) to be used for other positions of the member firm.
